intro: Eremogone franklinii, commonly known as Franklin’s eremogone, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Eremogone franklinii is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
